Package org.twelve.presenters

Interface ThresholdPresenter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UIThresholdsPresenter
    public interface ThresholdPresenter
    Interface for managing thresholds.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean getIsAdmin()
      Getter for if the user is an admin
      int getLendMoreThanBorrow()
      Getter for the number of times you can lend more than borrow
      int getMaxIncompleteTrade()
      Getter for the number of incomplete trades you can have
      int getMaxWeeklyTrade()
      Getter for the number of times you can trade in a week
      int getNumberOfDays()
      Getter for the number of days that a reverse trade happens after the initial temporary trade
      int getNumberOfEdits()
      Getter for the number of times a trade can be edited
      int getNumberOfStats()
      Getter for the number of one-way trades, two-way trades, and top-trading partners that an account should see in their trading dashboard.
      int getNumberOfTradesUntilTrusted()
      Getter for the number of trades that can be made until a user can be trusted
      void setIsAdmin​(boolean isAdmin)
      Setter for if the user is an admin
      void setThresholds​(int lendMoreThanBorrow, int maxIncompleteTrade, int maxWeeklyTrade, int numberOfDays, int numberOfStats, int numberOfEdits, int numberOfTradesUntilTrusted)
      Set the threshold values for this presenter

    • Method Detail

      • setThresholds

        void setThresholds​(int lendMoreThanBorrow,
                   int maxIncompleteTrade,
                   int maxWeeklyTrade,
                   int numberOfDays,
                   int numberOfStats,
                   int numberOfEdits,
                   int numberOfTradesUntilTrusted)
        Set the threshold values for this presenter
        Parameters:
        lendMoreThanBorrow - the number of times you can lend more than borrow
        maxIncompleteTrade - the number of incomplete trades you can have
        maxWeeklyTrade - the number of times you can trade in a week
        numberOfDays - the number of days that a reverse trade happens after the initial temporary trade
        numberOfStats - the number of one-way trades, two-way trades, and top-trading partners that an account should see in their trading dashboard.
        numberOfEdits - the number of times a trade can be edited
        numberOfTradesUntilTrusted - the number of trades that can be made until a user can be trusted
